metadata.description: Index for determining comparability of survey data between different years. Note: Q1, Q2, and Q3 are non-comparable due to methodology changes.

questions.text: Most important factors when looking for a new Job
questions.notes: Methodology changed between surveys.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are not available because the methodology changed.

questions.text: Factors to Stay at Current Company
questions.notes: Methodology changed between surveys.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are not available because the methodology changed.

questions.text: Factors to Leave Current Company
questions.notes: Although data exists for both years, the methodology has changed.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are not available because the methodology changed.

questions.text: The values a company promotes are extremely important to me
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: The ability to work flexibly and from wherever I want is critical to my work-life balance
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: It is important that a company understands the importance of the benefits that come alongside a salary
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: I would stay at a job if it paid me the salary I want, even if I hated the role
questions.notes: Response options include salary preferences.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: How well do you think you are paid for your work and skillset?
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: Are you planning on leaving your current role in the next three months?
questions.notes: Response options include: No, Considering, Applying and interviewing, Preparing to retire.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: What would your ideal role be?
questions.notes: Response options: In 2024: Permanent, Part time PAYE, Contract / Interim, Freelance. In 2025: Permanent Full Time, Part time, Contract / Interim Part Time, Contract / Interim Full Time, Freelance Part Time, Freelance Full Time.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are based only on data from the comparable markets: United Kingdom, United States, Australia, India, and Brazil. Data for any other markets are not included. Note: In the 2024 survey, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates were combined into one survey.

questions.text: How well do you think you are compensated for your skillset?
questions.notes: Similar to Q8 but with different wording. Maps to 2025 Q11.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question should be made with caution as the wording differs between 2024 (Q8) and 2025 (Q11).

questions.text: What would your ideal role be? (Duplicate of Q10)
questions.notes: Duplicate of Q10 in the 2025 survey with identical response options.
questions.userMessage: This question is a duplicate of Q10 in the 2025 survey. For year-on-year comparisons, please refer to Q10.

questions.text: What are the biggest challenges you face when working with colleagues from different generations?
questions.notes: New in 2025, focuses on generational differences.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are not available as this is a new question in the 2025 survey.

questions.text: Which of the following would help you collaborate better with colleagues from different generations?
questions.notes: New in 2025, focuses on solutions for generational collaboration.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are not available as this is a new question in the 2025 survey.

questions.text: Do you feel your company allows you to switch off at the end of the day without an expectation to answer emails or calls?
questions.notes: New in 2025, focuses on work-life boundaries.
questions.userMessage: Year‑on‑year comparisons for this question are not available as this is a new question in the 2025 survey.

comparisonRules.allowComparison: A comparison is performed only if the question's 'comparable' flag is true and data are available for both survey years for the comparable markets.
comparisonRules.fallback: If data exist in only one survey year, return that single dataset without attempting a comparison.
comparisonRules.lookupLogic: The chatbot will first query this index by question ID to determine comparability. For comparable questions, only data from the markets listed in 'comparableMarkets' will be used. If a user requests data for markets outside this list, the provided 'userMessage' will be displayed.
